customer_reviews.title: superior product!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using MOOM since it came out many many years ago (15?). They stopped carrying it at my local health food store. It's so much better for your skin than the petroleum based waxes that they may carry at the beauty supply shops. I use the men's version because it lasts longer and is the same formula. My favorite part of using this sugaring wax is that it's totally botanical, natural, and water soluble--so clean up is NO problem, should you have a little drip or spill.

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Time Repurchasing!
customer_reviews.text: This. Stuff. ROCKS. Nuff said. It does not irritate my sensitive skin AT ALL, and is a lot let painful than regular wax. The smell is even pleasant. It takes some time to learn to do this right, but once you've got it down, you can do this quickly and with minimal pain. I recently tried this again on my underarms (The first time I was not good at waxing yet, and it was PAINFUL!) but the second time I was ONE YEAR experienced with waxing and I did both underarms in about 8 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This is a large jar, so you might need to nuke it in the microwave for 30 seconds or so to get it to soften. If it is hot to the touch, wait for few minutes until it is warm. Otherwise you will end up with awkward burns on your skin. Apply in the direction of hair growth, and pull the fabric in the opposite direction. Pull the fabric off quickly for less pain. Make sure you have enough fabric strips and applicator (basically a wide popsicle stick) before you start. After shedding much hair, swimming in the pool feels so much better. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Koko

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Moom since the late 1990's and love it. I have thick, dark leg hair, and lots of it, and Moom has never failed me. I'll take the momentary pain over shaving any day. I like the fact that it's not a wax because it's very easy to remove from any surface with warm water. Moon For Men is the same product as the original Moom, just less expensive. I *highly* recommend it.

It removes hair just as well as the women's, it is unscented (I couldn't tell the lavender one even had any scent) and it was cheaper. Best hair removal product I've ever used!

customer_reviews.title: Not for those prone to ingrown hair
customer_reviews.text: Well it works pretty good for being an extremely hairy guy with thick dark hair. It's hard to guess what direction to pull when your hair is curly, but when pulled right it got all the hairs. Applying the thick wax is the most painful hair pulling part honestly. However, it says this pulls out the follicle. It might do that for some hair/skin types, but for me it left the follicle of most hairs leaving me with tons of of ingrown hairs the next day. I am prone to ingrown hairs when shaving, so I thought waxing would help prevent that, but this stuff is worse than shaving if anything! Just a warning for people with my skin type.

customer_reviews.title: Effective and great value (also - obviously - for either men or women)

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions!
customer_reviews.text: Works better than any other similiar product we have tried especially if you follow the directions. I would suggest closely monitoring the temperature, but heating more than the directions call for. The thinner/ warmer the consistency, the easier it is to apply, and the less product you use. You need to use it one good pass over everything. Then after bathing use a touch up. (for large body areas) Use the product every few weeks for a while,until the hair growth becomes sparser and sparser.
